content: stitch around 16 row 3 1 single_crochet increase x8 24 row 4 increase half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase half_double_crochet increase slip_stitch sl st fo mark the half_double_crochet increase with stitch markers this is the front leaving a long sewing tail cut off the working yarn part 2 row 1 mc 6 stitches - pull only semi tight so you can still run your hook through the center don t tighten it you ll be working in the mc center don t continue your stitches in a circle flip the half circle and work back along your previous stitches for each row row 2 chain 1 single_crochet increase x4 9 row 3 chain 3 single_crochet increase 1 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet 11 row 4 chain 4 single_crochet increase single_crochet increase 4 single_crochet 13 row 5 chain we re going to work in the spaces on the straight edge of the half circle there aren t specific holes for this but fabricate yourself 8 single_crochet and if it helps mark them so you don t lose them the center mc hole can hold 2 st if needed - this is your new row row 6 chain 8 single_crochet 8 row 7 chain 1 single_crochet decrease three times in a row 1 single_crochet 5 row 8 chain increase in each st 10 row 9 chain single_crochet across 10 row 10 chain single_crochet across 10 fo leaving a sewing tail cut the working yarn whip stitch this 10 single_crochet line onto part 1 wrong sides together across from the half_double_crochet stitch markers don t try to make the piece flat it s supposed to look like a z so that it fits better on the slug weave in the two mc ends not the sewing end of part 1 nobbles time for the nobbles this is the fussiest part of the pattern but if you persist you will get nice neat nobbles for your doomslug we ll start near the very front of the blue base to the right of the marked half_double_crochet those are the center of the forehead insert your hook from above through a space and out around a post near where doomslug s right eyebrow would be yo pull through then chain pull yarn tail snug you are now anchored and ready to make the nobbles on the back note if you would like to add those two ears that are in the caricature style of isaac stewart you can start with them see ears below put them over her eyebrows as the 1st and 4th nobble continue the pattern if you would like to add the ears later or not do them at all skip the ears part right beneath and move on to the nobbles section ears 1 chain 6 2 slip_stitch 5 back downwards on the loops of the chs you just made i would suggest 2 or 3 nobbles between the ears nobbles to make a nobble 1 chain 4 2 slip_stitch 3 stitches down on one of
